newsitem.title: USA: Wilshire Tech to cease trading on Amex.
newsitem.headline: Wilshire Tech to cease trading on Amex.

text.p: Wilshire Technologies Inc said on Friday that its common stock will cease to be traded on the American Stock Exchange because the company does not meet the exchange's listing criteria.
The last day for trading of the company's common stock on the American Stock Exchange will be Friday, January 17, 1997.
Wilshire said it was actively exploring alternative markets, and expected to have lined up a market for its common stock by Monday, January 20, 1997.
Wilshire also said it elected Ronald Cantwell as chairman of the board.
John Van Egmond was named as president and chief executive officer, replacing interim Chief Executive William Hopke, Wilshire said.
Cantwell has served as president of Trilon Dominion Partners LLC since its inception in June 1995, Wilshire said.
Van Egmond is affiliated with Trilon Dominion Partners LLC and has been president and chief executive officer of Century Power Corp since 1989, the company said.
Company representatives could not be reached for further comment.
